headline: BofA Raises GE Aerospace (GE) PT to $310, Cites the Company’s Raised 2025 Guidance
summary: GE Aerospace (NYSE:GE) is one of the best performing S&P 500 stocks to buy now. On July 28, BofA raised the firm’s price target on GE Aerospace to $310 from $230, while keeping a Buy rating on the shares. This sentiment by the firm followed the company’s raised 2025 guidance and 2028 expectations for double-digit […]

headline: Saudi Arabia Teleradiology Market Trends and Company Analysis Report 2025-2033 Featuring FUJIFILM, Koninklijke Philips, General Electric, Oracle, Siemens, GE, McKesson
summary: The Saudi Arabia Teleradiology Market is projected to grow from USD 100.46 million in 2024 to USD 263.93 million by 2033, experiencing a CAGR of 11.33% between 2025 and 2033. Key growth drivers include technological advancements, governmental support, and the need for remote diagnostics. This market evolution aligns with Saudi Arabia's Vision 2030, enhancing access to radiology expertise, especially in rural areas. headline: Saudi Arabia Circuit Breaker Market Outlook and Company Analysis Report 2025-2033 Featuring ABB, Alstom, Eaton, General Electric, Schneider Electric, Siemens, Camsco, G&W, Kirloskar, Larsen & Toubro
summary: The Saudi Arabia Circuit Breaker Market is projected to rise to US$ 152.32 million by 2033 from US$ 88.79 million in 2024, growing at a CAGR of 6.18% from 2025 to 2033. This growth is influenced by rapid urbanization, increasing power demand, and investments in smart grids and renewable energy. headline: GE Appliances to invest over $3 billion in US manufacturing push
summary: Global firms have been increasing their investments and presence in the United States after President Donald Trump pushed companies across sectors, including Apple and Ford, to produce goods within the country and generate jobs.  The GE Appliances investment will create 1,000 jobs in five states and is aimed at expanding the company's air conditioning and water heating portfolio, increasing production output and modernizing its 11 U.S. manufacturing plants with new automation and capital equipment, the home appliances maker said.  Earlier this year, peer Carrier Global also said it planned to invest $1 billion over five years in the U.S.

headline: Wall Street Is Warming to These 6 Industrial Stocks. They Don’t Depend on Nvidia or AI.
